A Closer Look At The Anthem-Cigna Merger

Law360, New York (February 18, 2016, 11:10 AM ET) -- Allen P. Grunes



Maurice Stucke How should the antitrust authorities look at a merger in an industry going through major transformation? The proposed merger of Anthem Inc. and Cigna Corp. squarely presents this question. The Affordable Care Act, with its focus on more efficient delivery of care and its shift away from the traditional “fee for service” model, is a game-changer. article_metadata.description: Our analysis suggests that the Anthem-Cigna merger is unlikely to harm the customers of the two companies and likely to promote, rather than slow down, the innovation that is already taking place. The first step to understanding this is to examine where Anthem and Cigna actually compete, say Allen Grunes and Maurice Stucke, co-founders of The Konkurrenz Group and former U.S. Department of Justice attorneys.
